wikipedia_page.main: Gilbert Robinson (born c. 1909 – death unknown) was a professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s and 1930s. He played at representative level for Great Britain (non-Test matches), and at club level for Wakefield Trinity (Heritage № 355), and Castleford (Heritage № 158), as a fullback or centre, i.e. number 1, or, 3 or 4.

response: *Gilbert Robinson, British rugby league footballer of the 1930s for Great Britain, Wakefield Trinity, and Castleford
